pros: The people, the location, everything.
cons: That we were closed down.

pros: relatively good salary at such positions
cons: there are no any cons

pros: Flexible hours, good holiday entitlement, staff are very friendly
cons: workload can be heavy, support sometimes lacking, salary doesn't always reflect the job expected of you.

pros:
Fair pay, 
good annual leave (25 holiday days plus 12 public holidays), 
no dress code, 
good progression opportunities, 
home/hybrid working,
canteen/ cafe area
cons: can feel a little out of touch when home working as nobody is in the office anymore, especially being a new staff member - meeting people only via computer screen

job_title: PhD Student and Research Assistant in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Friendly staff, innovative research, good working environment
cons: I did not find any negative aspects working here.

pros: Decent working environment, if you end up in a nice team.
cons: Salary could be considerably higher

pros: Strong immediate team support network
cons: Management often seem out of touch of what happens at the 'coal face'.

pros: Good place, lovely people, relaxed. The PhD is linked with the University of Edinburgh and I have had lots of freedom. I have not had any problems with financial support to attend courses or conferences.
cons: A little understimulating for PhD students and early career researchers, in my opinion. Lots of questionable and uninteresting research projects.

review_title: Great place to develop and grow your career
pros: Great working environment - no micromanaging bosses! Flexible working hours.
cons: Lot's of unneccessary admin work and faulty bureaucracy

pros: Nice people, interesting job, learning a lot
cons: Management rude and rid of empathy.

pros: Lots of training gained quickly
cons: There is a lack of progression

review_title: Relaxing atmosphere, friendly colleagues, not good for promotion
pros: The atmosphere was relaxing and fun. Most colleagues were very helpful and friendly. Work time was quite flexible.
cons: Not very good for promotion. Working here is lack of regular training and exchanging opinions within departments, Especially there is no sufficient investment for novel ideas and technologies.

review_title: Decent work environment but poor pay and unpaid overtime
pros: The people were nice and the location was good. Got to experience a different kind of laboratory work. Weekends off.
cons: Very poor pay. Amongst the worst for lab staff. 9 month probation is excessive. Often expected to work late with no compensation.

pros: Very friendly environment and focused on issues which I feel passionate about. It also allowed me to go to New Zealand to do the work I like doing. Supervision is excellent. Linked with the University of Edinburgh which is excellent as well.
cons: Very few cons. It is very cold living in Edinburgh.

pros:
Flexible and relaxed environment
Opportunity to learn and pick up new skills
Fairly open and team members are very friendly
Not strict control process
cons:
Not much career growth
Old technologies and slow to adapt to new technology
Less on resources / people

job_title: Human Resources Role in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: The people are the best thing, great to work with and passionate about agriculture.
cons: Major change needed at senior management level as they are advert to change.

review_title: Lovely location but dreadful senior management
pros: A lovely location with great colleagues; well-motivated students
cons: Very bad senior management with a complete unwillingness to change; some senior managers adopt crude bullying tactics; a justifiable lack of trust and respect for those in senior positions

review_title: No real research environment for early career researchers
pros: Some great staff who are willing to help each other out.
cons: Too many managers and not enough focus on research for the research divisions, a real shortage of post-doc level staff.

pros: It's a good place to strat after Uni.
cons: Low salary and lack of improvement

job_title: Academic Liaison Manager in Aberdeen, Scotland
pros: Friendly atmosphere, interesting people, diverse portfolio.
cons: I can't think of any!

pros: Good team,  variety within role day to day.
cons:
lack of progression
stressed management
unreal expectations
